meanings.def: at a short distance away from somebody/something
examples: Do you live near here?
Go and sit nearer (to) the fire.
When is your next appointment?
Turn left at the next traffic lights.
Who’s next?
Where’s the nearest supermarket?
Janet’s sitting nearest to the window (= of all the people in the room).
Sarah’s sitting next to the window (= right beside it).
Who’s sitting nearest the door?

meanings.def: a short period of time from something
examples: My birthday is very near Christmas.
I’ll think about it nearer (to) the time (= when it is just going to happen).

meanings.def: used before a number to mean ‘approximately’, ‘just below or above’
examples: Share prices are near their record high of last year.
Profits fell from $11 million to nearer $8 million.

meanings.def: similar to somebody/something in quality, size, etc.
examples: Nobody else comes near her in intellect.
He's nearer 70 than 60.
This colour is nearest (to) the original.

meanings.def: close to a particular state
examples: a state near (to) death
She was near to tears (= almost crying).
We came near to being killed.

meanings.def: close to you in time or distance
examples: Help was at hand.
The property is ideally located with all local amenities close at hand.

meanings.def: to be fairly accurate in a guess, statement, etc.
examples: Such guesses are thought to be close to the mark.
‘The Times’ was nearer the mark when it said…

meanings.def: having a lot of importance and interest for somebody

idioms.def: close to you in time or distance
examples: Help was at hand.
The property is ideally located with all local amenities close at hand.

idioms.def: to be fairly accurate in a guess, statement, etc.
examples: Such guesses are thought to be close to the mark.
‘The Times’ was nearer the mark when it said…

idioms.def: having a lot of importance and interest for somebody

related: so near and yet so far

meanings.def: a short distance away
examples: His house is very near.
Where's the nearest bank?
Wales may be a near neighbour but its history is quite distinct.
When is your next appointment?
Turn left at the next traffic lights.
Who’s next?
Where’s the nearest supermarket?
Janet’s sitting nearest to the window (= of all the people in the room).
Sarah’s sitting next to the window (= right beside it).
Who’s sitting nearest the door?

meanings.def: a short time away in the future
examples: The conflict is unlikely to be resolved in the near future (= very soon).
Working memory refers to the brain's ability to remember things in the short or near term.

meanings.def: coming next after somebody/something
examples: She has a 12-point lead over her nearest rival.

meanings.def: similar; most similar
examples: He was the nearest thing to (= the person most like) a father she had ever had.

meanings.def: close to being somebody/something
examples: The election proved to be a near disaster for the party.
a near impossibility
She spoke in a near whisper.
The climbers had already had one near miss on the summit.
the near future
a near neighbour
a near miss
a close contest
a close encounter
a close call
a close friend
close family
close links

meanings.def: used to describe a close family connection
examples: Only the nearest relatives were present at the funeral.

meanings.def: your close family and friends
a situation in which you are successful, but which could also have ended badly
examples: Phew! That was a near thing! It could have been a disaster.
We won in the end but it was a near thing.

meanings.def: followed by a number when counting or measuring approximately
examples: We calculated the cost to the nearest 50 dollars.

idioms.def: a situation in which you are successful, but which could also have ended badly
examples: Phew! That was a near thing! It could have been a disaster.
We won in the end but it was a near thing.

idioms.def: followed by a number when counting or measuring approximately
examples: We calculated the cost to the nearest 50 dollars.

meanings.def: at a short distance away
examples: A bomb exploded somewhere near.
She took a step nearer.
Visitors came from near and far.

meanings.def: a short time away in the future
examples: The exams are drawing near.

meanings.def: almost
examples: a near-perfect performance
I'm as near certain as can be.

meanings.def: as accurately as
examples: There were about 3 000 people there, as near as I could judge.

meanings.def: used to say that an amount is so nearly correct that the difference does not matter
examples: It will cost £350, or as near as dammit.

meanings.def: used to say that something is so nearly true that the difference does not matter
examples: We've been here twenty years, near enough.

meanings.def: far from; not at all
examples: The job doesn't pay anywhere near enough for me.
Older cars are nowhere near as fuel-efficient as modern cars.

meanings.def: almost; almost completely
examples: The first stage is pretty near finished.

meanings.def: used to comment on something that was almost successful but in fact failed

examples: There were about 3 000 people there, as near as I could judge.

idioms.def: used to say that an amount is so nearly correct that the difference does not matter
examples: It will cost £350, or as near as dammit.

idioms.def: used to say that something is so nearly true that the difference does not matter
examples: We've been here twenty years, near enough.
The job doesn't pay anywhere near enough for me.
Older cars are nowhere near as fuel-efficient as modern cars.
The first stage is pretty near finished.

idioms.idiom: so near and yet so far
idioms.def: used to comment on something that was almost successful but in fact failed

meanings.def: to come close to something in time or space
examples: The project is nearing completion.
She was nearing the end of her life.
He must be nearing 40.
We neared the top of the hill.
As Christmas neared, the children became more and more excited.
As she neared the door she slipped and fell.
As the bus neared we could see someone waving.
As we neared the island the cloud became thicker.
He began to worry as the day of their visit neared.
Her stay in New York was nearing its end.
It was nearing midnight.
Many of the teachers were nearing retirement.
More troops were nearing the besieged city.
She smiled as she neared the little group.
We were obviously nearing the airport.
